verses.text: Now Jericho was straitly shut up because of the children of Israel : none went out , and none came in.\f + \fr 6.1 \ft was…: Heb. did shut up, and was shut up\f*
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Joshua , See , I have given into thine hand Jericho , and the king thereof, \add and\add* the mighty men of valour.
And ye shall compass the city , all \add ye\add* men of war , \add and\add* go round about the city once. Thus shalt thou do six days.
And seven priests shall bear before the ark seven trumpets of rams’ horns : and the seventh day ye shall compass the city seven times , and the priests shall blow with the trumpets.

And it shall come to pass, that when they make a long \add blast\add* with the ram’s horn , \add and\add* when ye hear the sound of the trumpet , all the people shall shout with a great shout ; and the wall of the city shall fall down flat , and the people shall ascend up every man straight before him.\f + \fr 6.5 \ft flat: Heb. under it\f* \p

¶ And Joshua the son of Nun called the priests , and said unto them, Take up the ark of the covenant , and let seven priests bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And he said unto the people , Pass on , and compass the city , and let him that is armed pass on before the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p

¶ And it came to pass, when Joshua had spoken unto the people , that the seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams’ horns passed on before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and blew with the trumpets : and the ark of the covenant of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* followed them. \p

¶ And the armed men went before the priests that blew with the trumpets , and the rereward came after the ark , \add the priests\add* going on , and blowing with the trumpets.\f + \fr 6.9 \ft rereward: Heb. gathering host\f*

And Joshua had commanded the people , saying , Ye shall not shout , nor make any noise with your voice , neither shall \add any\add* word proceed out of your mouth , until the day I bid you shout ; then shall ye shout.\f + \fr 6.10 \ft any noise…: Heb. your voice to be heard\f*
So the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* compassed the city , going about \add it\add* once : and they came into the camp , and lodged in the camp. \p
¶ And Joshua rose early in the morning , and the priests took up the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And seven priests bearing seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* went on continually , and blew with the trumpets : and the armed men went before them; but the rereward came after the ark of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, \add the priests\add* going on , and blowing with the trumpets.
And the second day they compassed the city once , and returned into the camp : so they did six days.

And it came to pass on the seventh day , that they rose early about the dawning of the day , and compassed the city after the same manner seven times : only on that day they compassed the city seven times.
And it came to pass at the seventh time , when the priests blew with the trumpets , Joshua said unto the people , Shout ; for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath given you the city. \p

¶ And the city shall be accursed , \add even\add* it, and all that \add are\add* therein, to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: only Rahab the harlot shall live , she and all that \add are\add* with her in the house , because she hid the messengers that we sent.\f + \fr 6.17 \ft accursed: or, devoted\f*

And ye, in any wise keep \add yourselves\add* from the accursed thing , lest ye make \add yourselves\add* accursed , when ye take of the accursed thing , and make the camp of Israel a curse , and trouble it.\f + \fr 6.18 \ft accursed: or, devoted\f*\f + \fr 6.18 \ft a curse: or, devoted\f*

But all the silver , and gold , and vessels of brass and iron , \add are\add* consecrated unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: they shall come into the treasury of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.  +  r 6.19  t consecrated: Heb. holiness *

So the people shouted when \add the priests\add* blew with the trumpets : and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet , and the people shouted with a great shout , that the wall fell down flat , so that the people went up into the city , every man straight before him, and they took the city.\f + \fr 6.20 \ft flat: Heb. under it\f*
And they utterly destroyed all that \add was\add* in the city , both man and woman , young and old , and ox , and sheep , and ass , with the edge of the sword.
But Joshua had said unto the two men that had spied out the country , Go into the harlot’s house , and bring out thence the woman , and all that she hath, as ye sware unto her.

And the young men that were spies went in , and brought out Rahab , and her father , and her mother , and her brethren , and all that she had; and they brought out all her kindred , and left them without the camp of Israel.\f + \fr 6.23 \ft kindred: Heb. families\f*

And they burnt the city with fire , and all that \add was\add* therein: only the silver , and the gold , and the vessels of brass and of iron , they put into the treasury of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And Joshua saved Rahab the harlot alive , and her father’s household , and all that she had; and she dwelleth in Israel \add even\add* unto this day ; because she hid the messengers , which Joshua sent to spy out Jericho. \p

¶ And Joshua adjured \add them\add* at that time , saying , Cursed \add be\add* the man before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that riseth up and buildeth this city Jericho : he shall lay the foundation thereof in his firstborn , and in his youngest \add son\add* shall he set up the gates of it.
So the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was with Joshua ; and his fame was \add noised\add* throughout all the country.
